direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods check the state of the composite maps but return different boolean results.
Both methods modify the state of the composite maps, but clear() removes all mappings.
Both methods access the composite maps to check for the presence of keys or entries.
Both methods access the composite maps to check for the presence of values or entries.
Both methods modify the state of the composite maps, but remove() removes a specific mapping.

enhanced_by.reason: Adding a map to the composite affects the size calculation.
Removing a map from the composite affects the size calculation.
Adding a key-value pair affects the size calculation.
Removing a key-value pair affects the size calculation.
The result of isEmpty() can be used to assert the size of the composite map.
The presence of a key can be used to assert the size of the composite map.
The presence of a value can be used to assert the size of the composite map.
